alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 26 at 4:02PM MDT until May 26 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Weld County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 430 PM MDT. * At 402 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles northeast of Purcell, or 25 miles northeast of Greeley, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Weld County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
